data.meanings: (Dal-Nun-Alif) To be near, come near or low, let down, be akin to.
data.sentence: The word الدُّنْيَا comes from the root د ن و and is associated with the meanings: (Dal-Nun-Alif) To be near, come near or low, let down, be akin to.

data.meanings: (a doubly imperfect verb) To live, be alive, be ashamed, spend (the night) awake, fertilize the earth, keep anyone alive; spare any one, let anyone alive, remove prudency, modesty and shamefulness, make immodest
data.sentence: The word الْحَيَوةَ comes from the root ح ي ي and is associated with the meanings: (a doubly imperfect verb) To live, be alive, be ashamed, spend (the night) awake, fertilize the earth, keep anyone alive; spare any one, let anyone alive, remove prudency, modesty and shamefulness, make immodest

data.meanings: to relate, narrate, recite, choose, propose, transmit, raise, prefer, effect, excite.. To stir up, to trump up.. Determined/resolved/decided upon a thing.. Origin, time/period of life.. Dearth, scarcity, drought or sterility.. An iron instrument with which the bottom of a camel's foot is marked, or a camel with such a mark.. A generous quality/action (e.g. passed down from generation to generation).. athar means after, footstep/trace/mark/track/remnant/tradition/teaching, impression/influence, stamp/scar, remains, relics of knowledge transmitted, sunnah, vestige, print, memorial of antiquity.
data.sentence: The word وَءَاثَرَ comes from the root ا ث ر and is associated with the meanings: to relate, narrate, recite, choose, propose, transmit, raise, prefer, effect, excite.. To stir up, to trump up.. Determined/resolved/decided upon a thing.. Origin, time/period of life.. Dearth, scarcity, drought or sterility.. An iron instrument with which the bottom of a camel's foot is marked, or a camel with such a mark.. A generous quality/action (e.g. passed down from generation to generation).. athar means after, footstep/trace/mark/track/remnant/tradition/teaching, impression/influence, stamp/scar, remains, relics of knowledge transmitted, sunnah, vestige, print, memorial of antiquity.
